messages.title: Labour’s tax on jobs will kill the recovery
messages.content: The re-election of Gordon Brown’s government with more debt, waste and taxes will bring us a new recession.

messages.title: Backing the NHS
messages.content: The NHS is our number one priority. We back it and we want to improve it for everyone.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Promotes fiscal responsibility by highlighting waste in the current government's handling of the economy and emphasizing the need to cut waste, not frontline services.
Strives to make Kingston Hospital safe, supporting Accident and Emergency, A&E, and Maternity Services. Committed to NHS as their number one priority to back and improve.

issues.economy: Promotes fiscal responsibility and emphasizes the need to cut waste, not frontline services.
issues.health: Committed to making Kingston Hospital safe, backing A&E and Maternity Services, NHS is the number one priority.

leaflet.personalStatement: Helen believes in action, that's why her plan is about getting things done, not just talking about them.

politicalExperience.role: Conservative Parliamentary hopeful for Kingston and Surbiton
politicalExperience.achievements: Highlighted commitment to investing in the NHS and expanding support for Kingston Hospital including A&E and Maternity Services.

endorsements.endorsement: Helen Whately with David Cameron showing support.

quotes.text: Helen Whately, Conservative Parliamentary hopeful for Kingston and Surbiton said, 'We have committed to investing in the NHS. That means Kingston's local health services won't need to downgrade...'

images.caption: Helen Whately campaigning in Kingston and Surbiton.
